title: Maxell Logo Font ID?
content:
Hi folks, I just found this board and you guys are amazing. I have a feeling I'll be asking for help here a lot. :)

Anyway, need to know if anyone can ID the font used in the Maxell logo. Thanks in advance. (I attached a file, but if I made an error, the logo can be seen here: [http://www.maxell.com/images/mx\_r2\_c1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20110227130049/http:/www.maxell.com/images/mx_r2_c1.gif "http://www.maxell.com/images/mx\_r2\_c1.gif"))

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [maxell.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20110227130049/http:/typophile.com/files/maxell.gif) | 7.03 KB |
author: dstrauss

comments.content: Jan is right. In case you’re looking for something similar, try [Register](http://web.archive.org/web/20110227130049/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Register&x=0&y=0&sample_text=maxell&sample_size=60).

Florian.

Have you sent in your entry yet?

[http://www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=272](http://web.archive.org/web/20110227130049/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=272 "http://www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=272")

(Sorry, off topic)

I saw it too late … damn! I just have tinkered a quickie and send it, now I hope The Mighty Unzipper has mercy. Thanks, Jan ;°)

[edit: Yes, he has. Cool!]

Some years ago, [Büro Destruct](http://web.archive.org/web/20110227130049/http:/www.burodestruct.net/) created a typeface, based on the letter forms found in the Maxell Logo, named ' [Elmax](http://web.archive.org/web/20110227130049/http:/www.typedifferent.com/2003/index.html)', released/published as a free font under their [Type Different](http://web.archive.org/web/20110227130049/http:/www.typedifferent.com/) label.

Dav(id)
Thank you all for the quick and helpful responses.
